text:
Rich tributes were paid by speakers to national poet Subramania Bharathiar at a function held to mark the celebrations of his birth anniversary organised by the district administration at Perunthalaivar Kamarajar College of Education here on Monday.

M. Chandracasu, Minister for Agriculture, who presided over the function, traced the poet’s link with Pondicherry (now Puducherry) where he authored popular patriotic and literary works.

P. Manjini, Assistant Library Officer, explained Subramania Bharathiar’s untiring efforts in the cause of freedom of our country.

Earlier, Mr. Chandracasu paid floral tributes to a portrait of the poet.
title: Rich tributes paid to Bharathiar
